instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan runs on high
threads.message:
It looks like the board has been previously ultrasonic'ed so Im trying to figure out where the corrosion was, I don't have ASD162 but have attached the Istat Sensor readings, nothing looks too out of place but you can see the fan is running at over 6K.  Computer seems to run a little slow at times too.  
Where should I look first for readings, usual suspects?

[ATTACH type="full" width="197px"]23832._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan runs on high
threads.message:
I hope those temps are if F?

I suggest you find 3S162 to see if there are any sensor issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan runs on high
threads.message: I thought the same thing, thankfully they are
